property.description: The Datastores report Lists all Datastore details and related key information.

property.name: Datastore
property.description: Name of the Datastore.

property.name: Datastore Cluster
property.description: Name of the Datastore cluster if the datastore is part of DS cluster.

property.name: Datacenter
property.description: Datstore's Datacenter Name.

property.name: vCenter
property.description: Datastore's vCenter Server name.

property.name: Type
property.description: FileSystem type of the Datastore, like VMFS, NFS etc.

property.name: Hosts
property.description: Number of ESX servers sharing this Datastore.

property.name: Capacity
property.description: Total Capacity of the Datastore.

property.name: Provisioned
property.description: Total Provisioned space of the Datastore.

property.name: Used Space
property.description: Total Used space of the Datastore.

property.name: Free Space
property.description: Total Free space of the Datastore.

property.name: Free (%)
property.description: Free space of the Datastore in percentage.

property.name: Bandwidth
property.description: Total Bandwidth of the Datastore issued by All shared ESX Servers.

property.name: Throughput (IOPS)
property.description: Total Throughput(IOPS) of the Datastore issued by All shared ESX Servers.

property.name: Latency(ms)
property.description: Total Latency of the Datastore issued by All shared ESX Servers.

property.name: Customer
property.description: User-defined customer name associated with the device.

property.name: Business Unit
property.description: User-defined business unit associated with the device.

property.name: Location
property.description: User-defined location associated with the device.

property.displayedProperties: type[Type] partsn[LUN Serial#] rootnas[Remote NAS Host] rootpath[Remote NAS Path]

parameter.name: metric
parameter.properties: svclevel device part dgraid arraytyp sgname dgstype poolname

property.description: The Capacity of the device.

property.filterExpression: name=='Capacity' & viprsys & vsaname & vspname & volname & tenname & prjname

property.description: The response time of read operations.
The amount of data read per second.
The number of read operations per second.

property.name: Name
property.description: VASA Provider Name

property.name: URL
property.description: VASA Provider URL
The Hosts report Lists all Hypervisors and related key information. This report is useful to compare servers in order to take decision for virtualization solutions.

property.name: Name
property.description: Name of the ESX Server / Hypervisor.

property.name: Cluster
property.description: ESX Server's Cluster name.

property.name: Version
property.description: ESX Server's version.

property.name: Status
property.description: Status of the ESX Server

property.name: VMotion
property.description: VMotion is configured on the ESX Server

property.name: VMs In HighCpu
property.description: Number of VMs which are using high CPU in the ESX Server.

property.name: CPU (%)
property.description: CPU Usage in Percentage.

property.name: Memory (%)
property.description: Memory Usage of the ESX Server in percentage.

property.name: Memory Size
property.description: Total Memory of the ESX Server.

property.displayedProperties: cluster[Cluster] device[ESX host] status[Status] ip[IP] vmotion[Vmotion capable] devdesc[ESX Version] nbcpu[CPU Count] nbcore[Core Count] nbnic[NIC Count]

property.description: The Virtual Machines report Lists all Virtual Machines and related key information.

property.name: Name
property.description: Name of the Virtual Machine.

property.name: VM Profile
property.description: Profile of the Virtual Machine.

property.name: IP
property.description: IP Address of the VM.

property.name: Host
property.description: Virtual Machine's Hypervisor.

property.name: Resource Pool
property.description: Resource Pool of the VM.

property.name: Guest OS
property.description: Guest Operating System Name.

property.name: State
property.description: Current state of the Virtual Machine (powered off, on etc.)

property.name: Status
property.description: Current status of the Virtual Machine (Normal, Warning etc.)

property.name: Nb. of vCPU
property.description: Number of Virtual CPUs of the VM.

property.name: Memory Size
property.description: Total Memory of the VM.

property.name: Memory (%)
property.description: Memory usage in percentage. Available only for powered on VM.

property.name: CPU Usage (GHz)
property.description: CPU usage in GHz. Available only for powered on VM.

property.name: CPU (%)
property.description: CPU usage in percentage. Available only for powered on VM.

property.name: Read Throughput IOPS
property.description: Total number of disk Read IOs per second. Available only for powered on VM.

property.name: Write Throughput IOPS
property.description: Total number of disk Write IOs per second. Available only for powered on VM.

property.name: Throughput IOPS
property.description: Total number of disk IOs per second. Available only for powered on VM.
Many report are not available when the VM is shutdown
Columns Hostname, Operating System, No. vCPU will be populated only if VMware tools are installed.

property.name: Customer
property.description: User-defined customer name associated with the device.

property.name: Business Unit
property.description: User-defined business unit associated with the device.

property.name: Location
property.description: User-defined location associated with the device.
The Datastores report Lists all Datastore details and related key information.

property.name: Datastore Name
property.description: Name of the Datastore.

property.name: Datastore Cluster
property.description: Name of the Datastore cluster if the datastore is part of DS cluster.

property.name: Type
property.description: FileSystem type of the Datastore, like VMFS, NFS etc.

property.name: NAS Server
property.description: Nas Server where the Datastore is created.

property.name: NAS Path
property.description: Remote Path of the Datasore.

property.name: Capacity
property.description: Total Capacity of the Datastore.

property.name: Provisioned
property.description: Provisioned space of the Datastore.

property.name: Free (%)
property.description: Free space of the Datastore in percentage.

property.name: Free Space
property.description: Total Free space of the Datastore.

property.displayedProperties: type[Type] url[URL] partsn[LUN Serial#] rootnas[NAS Device] rootpath[NAS Path]

parameter.name: metric
parameter.properties: svclevel device part dgraid arraytyp sgname dgstype poolname

property.description: The Capacity of the device.

property.filterExpression: name=='Capacity' & viprsys & vsaname & vspname & volname & tenname & prjname

property.description: The response time of read operations.
The amount of data read per second.
The number of read operations per second.
This report is useful to compare servers in order to take decision for virtualization solutions.

property.displayedProperties: cluster[Cluster] device[ESX host] status[Status] ip[IP] vmotion[Vmotion capable] devdesc[ESX Version] nbcpu[CPU Count] nbcore[Core Count] nbnic[NIC Count]

property.description: A short spike in CPU usage indicates that you are making the best use of the host resources. However, if thevalue is constantly high, the host is probably overcommitted. Generally, if the CPU usage value for a virtual machine is above 90%, performance is impacted.
Note: If a row does not contain any value in the column "VM", there are no additional details to provide upon clicking on that row.

property.displayedProperties: guestnam[Guest operating system] device esx[Currently hosted on ESX] numcpu[Number of CPUs] vdisks[Number of virtual disks] memsize[Memory Size (Mb)] ip

property.filterExpression: source=='VMWareCollector' & parttype=='Power Supply' | parttype=='Fan' | parttype=='System Board'

property.description: The Virtual Machines report Lists all Virtual Machines and related key information. Note: Provisioned Space mentioned in this table is the Total Provsioned space for the selected VM.

property.name: Name
property.description: Name of the Virtual Machine.

property.name: State
property.description: Current state of the Virtual Machine. Like powered off, on etc.

property.name: Status
property.description: Current status of the Virtual Machine. Like Normal, Warning etc.

property.name: Datacenter
property.description: Datacenter of the Virtual Machine.

property.name: ESX
property.description: Virtual Machine's Hypervisor.

property.name: Guest OS
property.description: Guest Operating System Name.

property.name: Provisioned Space
property.description: Provisioned Space is the Total Provsioned space for the selected VM. Not only provisioned space from the selected Datastore.

property.name: Disk Read
property.description: Disk Read throughput of the VM (All disks used by the selected VM).

property.name: Disk Write
property.description: Disk Write throughput of the VM (All disks used by the selected VM).
Note: Provisioned Space mentioned in this table is the Total Provisioned Space of the selected VM.
For the capacity to be assigned to a service-level, the LUN providing the storage must be monitored (in the last 24h)

parameter.name: metric
parameter.properties: svclevel device part dgraid arraytyp sgname dgstype poolname

property.description: The Capacity of the device.

property.filterExpression: name=='Capacity' & viprsys & vsaname & vspname & volname & tenname & prjname

property.description: The response time of read operations.
The amount of data read per second.
The number of read operations per second.
The Virtual Disks report Lists all Virtual Disks and related key information. Note: For this highly detailed report, some columns could be empty if SRM collection level is below 2.

property.name: Virtual Disk
property.description: Name of the Virtual Disk of the VM.

property.name: ThinProvisioned
property.description: Is this disk Thin Provisioned?

property.name: Capacity
property.description: Total Capacity of of the Virtual Disk.
Note: For this highly detailed report, some columns could be empty if SRM collection level is below 2.
This report is useful to compare servers in order to take decision for virtualization solutions.

parameter.name: metric
parameter.properties: svclevel device part dgraid arraytyp sgname dgstype poolname

property.description: The Capacity of the device.

property.filterExpression: name=='Capacity' & viprsys & vsaname & vspname & volname & tenname & prjname

property.description: The response time of read operations.
The amount of data read per second.
The number of read operations per second.
Note: For this highly detailed report, some columns could be empty if SRM collection level is below 2.

Sum of the data read and written across all disk instances on the virtual machine.
Note: For this highly detailed report, Data could be empty if SRM collection level is below 2.

node.name: Physical/LUN Disks IO by this VM

property.description: Note: For this highly detailed report, some columns could be empty if SRM collection level is below 2.
Note: For this highly detailed report, some columns could be empty if SRM collection level is below 2.

A short spike in CPU usage indicates that you are making the best use of the host resources. However, if thevalue is constantly high, the host is probably overcommitted. Generally, if the CPU usage value for a virtual machine is above 90%, performance is impacted.

property.filterExpression: EventType=='VmClonedEvent' | EventType=='VmCloneFailedEvent' | EventType=='VmMigratedEvent' | EventType=='VmBeingHotMigratedEvent' | EventType=='VmEmigratingEvent' | EventType=='VmBeingClonedEvent' | source=='VMWareCollector' | EventType=='DrsVmMigratedEvent' | EventType=='ScheduledTaskCompletedEvent' | EventType=='ScheduledTaskStartedEvent'

property.displayedProperties: guestnam[Guest operating system] device esx[Currently hosted on ESX] numcpu[Number of CPUs] vdisks[Number of virtual disks] memsize[Memory Size (Mb)] ip

property.description:
B CPU ready % is computed from the CPU latency using this formula
  • (CPU summation value / ( * 1000)) * 100 = CPU ready %
  • The formula use default vcenter update intervals for the performance metric which is for realtime: 20 seconds
Note: For this highly detailed report, some metrics like CPU ready could be empty if SRM collection level is below 2.

CPU ready % from the CPU ready summation value, use this formula:
(CPU summation value / (<chart default update interval in seconds> * 1000)) * 100 = CPU ready %

CPU ready % from the CPU ready summation value, use this formula:
(CPU summation value / (<chart default update interval in seconds> * 1000)) * 100 = CPU ready %

property.filterExpression: part=='System' & parttype=='Memory' & (name=='Balloon' | name=='Active' | name=='BalloonTarget' | name=='Swapped' | name=='Shared')

property.description:
Amount of guest physical memory that is currently reclaimed from the virtual machine through ballooning. This is the amount of guest physical memory that has been allocated and pinned by the balloon driver.
If a virtual machine has high ballooning or swapping, check the amount of free physical memory on the host.
Note: For this highly detailed report, some metrics could be empty if SRM collection level is below 2.

Swap In Rate: Rate at which memory is swapped from disk into active memory during the current interval. Swap Out Rate: Rate at which memory is being swapped from active memory to disk during the current interval.
Those counters is useful to determine if the virtual machine is running slow due to swapping, especially when looking at real-time statistics. If a virtual machine has high ballooning or swapping, check the amount of free physical memory on the host.
Percentage of RAM used by the virtual machine.

Note: Data collection for some of the network metrics like - InPackets, OutPackets, Received , transmitted etc are being enabled at collection level 3. If we see missing and need details, please make sure data collection is at level 3.

The Network Interfaces report Lists all Network Interfaces and related key information.
Click here to display column definitions
  • Network Name: Name of the Virtual Network.
  • MAC Address: Mac Address of the Virtual Network Interface.
  • Availability:Availability of the Virtual Network Interface, in percentage.

property.name: Network Name
property.description: Name of the Virtual Network.

property.name: MAC Address
property.description: Mac Address of the Virtual Network Interface.

property.name: Availability
property.description: Availability of the Virtual Network Interface, in percentage.

property.displayedProperties: cluster[Cluster] device[ESX host] status[Status] ip[IP] vmotion[Vmotion capable] devdesc[ESX Version] nbcpu[CPU Count] nbcore[Core Count] nbnic[NIC Count]
